channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Ryan Routh is charged with attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump
item.description: In addition to attempting to assassinate a presidential candidate, Routh was charged with possessing a firearm in furtherance of a violent crime and assaulting a federal officer.
item.content:encoded:
In addition to attempting to assassinate a presidential candidate, Routh was charged with possessing a firearm in furtherance of a violent crime and assaulting a federal officer.

(Image credit: Nicolas Garcia)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Going once … going twice: Alex Jones’ cameras, mics, Infowars show, vitamin site
item.description: A federal bankruptcy judge has ruled that a plan to sell off the assets of Jones' media company, Free Speech Systems, can move ahead. Net proceeds will go to the Sandy Hook families who Jones defamed.
item.content:encoded:
A federal bankruptcy judge has ruled that a plan to sell off the assets of Jones' media company, Free Speech Systems, can move ahead. Net proceeds will go to the Sandy Hook families who Jones defamed.

(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Trump vows to 'steal' jobs from other countries in winding speech on economic plans
item.description: Former President Donald Trump called for a "manufacturing renaissance" in a Savannah, Ga. speech on Tuesday, proposing measures some economists say would raise prices on Americans.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump called for a "manufacturing renaissance" in a Savannah, Ga. speech on Tuesday, proposing measures some economists say would raise prices on Americans.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: A new poll of young voters shows Harris with a commanding 31 point lead over Trump
item.description: The poll from the Harvard Kennedy School's Institute of Politics shows Harris well ahead among likely voters 18 to 29. It’s a promising sign for Harris, who is banking on high levels of youth support.
item.content:encoded:
The poll from the Harvard Kennedy School's Institute of Politics shows Harris well ahead among likely voters 18 to 29. It’s a promising sign for Harris, who is banking on high levels of youth support.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: US Capitol statue of Johnny Cash depicts Arkansas's history and progress
item.description: Arkansas unveiled a new statue of Johnny Cash in the U.S. Capitol. Cash, the first musician to be honored in the building, replaces a statue of a Confederate general.
item.content:encoded:
Arkansas unveiled a new statue of Johnny Cash in the U.S. Capitol. Cash, the first musician to be honored in the building, replaces a statue of a Confederate general.

(Image credit: SAUL LOEB/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: The state of Maryland sues Dali ship owner and manager over the Key Bridge collapse
item.description: State leaders argue that the cargo ship was not fit to sail on March 26, and its owner, Grace Ocean Private Limited, and manager, Synergy Marine Group, failed to take precautions to prevent the crash.
item.content:encoded:
State leaders argue that the cargo ship was not fit to sail on March 26, and its owner, Grace Ocean Private Limited, and manager, Synergy Marine Group, failed to take precautions to prevent the crash.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: How Do Russians Really Feel About the War in Ukraine?
item.description:
In Russia, polls consistently show support for the war in Ukraine somewhere around 70%. But a recent independent study of Russians' opinions indicates the picture is more complex. We hear more from our correspondent in Moscow.

And in Ukraine, couples who are separated by the war can now propose and get married online over an app. The service is so popular there is a months-long wait for virtual ceremonies.
item.content:encoded:
In Russia, polls consistently show support for the war in Ukraine somewhere around 70%. But a recent independent study of Russians' opinions indicates the picture is more complex. We hear more from our correspondent in Moscow.

And in Ukraine, couples who are separated by the war can now propose and get married online over an app. The service is so popular there is a months-long wait for virtual ceremonies.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: Justice Department accuses Visa of stifling competition in the debit card business
item.description: The Justice Department has sued Visa, accusing the giant payments company of seeking to monopolize the debit card business.
item.content:encoded:
The Justice Department has sued Visa, accusing the giant payments company of seeking to monopolize the debit card business.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Tropical Storm Helene threatens the U.S., Mexico
item.description: Tropical Storm Helene's trajectory threatens the Florida panhandle, which forecasters say could be hit on Thursday. Meteorologists say this system will be particularly big -- with a wide wind field.
item.content:encoded:
Tropical Storm Helene's trajectory threatens the Florida panhandle, which forecasters say could be hit on Thursday. Meteorologists say this system will be particularly big -- with a wide wind field.

(Image credit: The National Hurricane Center)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Biden pledges mpox aid to Africa in his valedictory speech to the United Nations
item.description: President Biden talked about the sweeping changes he has seen during his long career, urged an end to wars in Ukraine, Gaza and Sudan, and said "some things are more important than staying in power."
item.content:encoded:
President Biden talked about the sweeping changes he has seen during his long career, urged an end to wars in Ukraine, Gaza and Sudan, and said "some things are more important than staying in power."

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid
